defs.docs:
`version-sync` provides macros for keeping version numbers in sync
 with your crate version.

attributes.value: / `version-sync` provides macros for keeping version numbers in sync
/ When making a release of a Rust project, you typically need to
/ adjust some version numbers in your code and documentation. This
/ crate gives you macros that covers some typical cases where
/ * TOML examples in the `README.md` files that show how to add a
/ * A `Changelog.md` file that should at least mention the current
/ * The [`html_root_url`] attribute that tells other crates where to
/ Except for [`assert_contains_substring`], the macros are gated
/ behind individual features, as detailed below.
/ A typical configuration will use an integration test to verify
/ that all version numbers are in sync. Create a
/ When you run `cargo test`, your version numbers will be
/ In case you only need some of the macros above, you can disable
/ them individually using Cargo features. The features are:
/ All of these features are enabled by default.

defs.name: check_contains_regex
defs.docs:
Check that `path` contain the regular expression given by
 `template`.

attributes.value: / Check that `path` contain the regular expression given by
/ The placeholders `{name}` and `{version}` will be replaced with
/ `pkg_name` and `pkg_version`, if they are present in `template`.
/ It is okay if `template` do not contain these placeholders.
/ The matching is done in multi-line mode, which means that `^` in
/ the regular expression will match the beginning of any line in the
/ file, not just the very beginning of the file.
/ If the regular expression cannot be found, an `Err` is returned
/ with a succinct error message. Status information has then already

defs.docs: Check that `path` contain the substring given by `template`.

/ If the template cannot be found, an `Err` is returned with a
/ succinct error message. Status information has then already been

/ `html_root_url` attributes. Such an attribute must specify a valid
/ URL and if the URL points to docs.rs, it must be point to the

defs.name: check_markdown_deps
defs.docs: Check dependencies in Markdown code blocks.

attributes.value: / Check dependencies in Markdown code blocks.
/ This function finds all TOML code blocks in `path` and looks for
/ dependencies on `pkg_name` in those blocks. A code block fails the
/ check if it has a dependency on `pkg_name` that doesn't match
/ `pkg_version`, or if it has no dependency on `pkg_name` at all.
/ Consider a package named `foo` with version 1.2.3. The following
/ TOML block will pass the test:
/ Both `dependencies` and `dev-dependencies` are examined. If you
/ want to skip a block, add `no_sync` to the language line:
/ Code blocks also fail the check if they cannot be parsed as TOML.
/ If any block fails the check, an `Err` is returned with a succinct
/ error message. Status information has then already been printed on
